page.title: 02The Village of Cuxton
page.content: Most people live in Cuxton itself. Some live further along the main road towards Halling and a few in the hamlet of Upper Bush. There are 1240 houses in Cuxton. The population of the village is about 3150. A busy main road{(A228)}cuts through the village. This divides the railway station, a small industrial site by the river and the White Hart public house, from the main centre of population. Most houses are semi-detached and were built in the 1960s. There are a few older houses, the oldest built in the 14th Century. There is a small Parade of shops, a Police Office, Social Club, filling station and a garage. The Primary School is next to the recreation ground. Above the village, to the south, stands the{Norman church of St Michael's and All Angels which, this year celebrates the 800th (cont)
